senses.ex: The value of the house has increased over the years.

Tips.title: Market Influence
Tips.description: Value can fluctuate based on demand, rarity, or market trends.
Tips.example: The value of vintage cars can skyrocket as they become rarer.

Tips.title: Context Specific
Tips.description: Value differs in contexts like insurance, appraisals, or sales.
Tips.example: For insurance purposes, the value of her necklace was appraised higher.

senses.ex: He sees great value in learning a second language.

Tips.title: Subjective Assessment
Tips.description: What's valuable to one may not be to another due to personal interests.
Tips.example: To a musician, the value of a rare instrument is unparalleled.

Tips.title: Cultural Variation
Tips.description: Different cultures value different things, often reflected in idioms.
Tips.example: In many cultures, the value of hospitality is expressed in sayings.

senses.de: A person's principles or moral standards.
senses.ex: Honesty is a value that he holds dear.

Tips.title: Personal Conviction
Tips.description: Values guide personal conduct and are often non-negotiable.
Tips.example: His refusal to lie at work shows the value he places on honesty.

Tips.title: Cultural Reflection
Tips.description: Values can reflect a society's norm and can change over time.
Tips.example: The values of ancient societies can be gleaned from their laws.

senses.de: To consider something as important or useful.
senses.ex: She values her time and does not like to waste it.

Tips.title: Not Monetary
Tips.description: Valuing in this sense is emotional or intellectual, not financial.
Tips.example: She truly values your friendship even though it's not tangible.

Tips.title: Acknowledging Quality
Tips.description: To value can mean recognizing something's superior quality.
Tips.example: A good employer values dedication in their employees.

senses.de: To determine how much money something could be sold for.
senses.ex: The jeweler valued the diamond at three thousand dollars.

Tips.title: Expert Opinion
Tips.description: A professional often values an item based on their expertise.
Tips.example: The appraiser valued the painting based on the artist's reputation.

Tips.title: Estimate Precision
Tips.description: The value assigned can be an estimate, not always exact.
Tips.example: They valued the company at $2 million, give or take a few thousands.

Advantage.wordDefinition:
Advantage is something that gives a better position or benefit over others. For example, a runner who starts ahead of others has an advantage over them.

Both words are applicable in different contexts. Advantage is usually used in contexts where there is competition or comparison, while value is used in contexts where there is a need for evaluation or assessment of worth.

For a 15 year old, advantage could be thought of as having an edge or head start, while value could be thought of as something being useful or important.

Appreciate.wordDefinition:
Appreciate means to recognize the worth or quality of something or someone. It's usually used when someone is grateful for something or someone.

For example, "I appreciate your help with my homework." It is applicable when you are thanking someone for their help or kindness.

Benefit.wordDefinition:
Benefit refers to the advantage or profit gained from something. For example, if you start exercising regularly, the benefits could include improved health, increased energy, and better mood.

In general, benefits are more specific and measurable, while value is more general and subjective. Benefits apply to individual instances or situations, while value can apply to a broad range of things.

Both words are applicable in many contexts, from personal decisions to business strategies. In making decisions, it is important to consider both the benefits and the value of different options.

Esteem.wordDefinition:
Esteem refers to the level of respect or admiration that someone has towards another person or thing. It describes the positive feelings you have towards something or someone.

For example, you can esteem a friend for their kind and caring personality, while valuing your phone for its functionality and usefulness.

Esteem is more applicable when talking about people or relationships, while value is more applicable when talking about objects or things.

Important.wordDefinition:
Important relates to how much attention or significance something deserves. For example, a test may be important because it determines a student's grade.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Important is more commonly used to describe how much attention something deserves, while value describes how much something is worth.

However, both words can be used interchangeably in some contexts, such as when discussing the importance or value of something to a specific person or group.

Merit.wordDefinition:
Merit refers to the qualities or achievements that make someone deserving of recognition or reward.

It is often used in academic or professional settings to evaluate a person's performance and potential. Merit is usually based on factors such as skills, abilities, hard work, and accomplishments.

Merit is about earning recognition or reward based on one's qualities and achievements, while value is about assigning worth or importance to something based on personal judgment or cultural norms.

Significance.wordDefinition:
Significance represents the importance or meaning of something. It focuses on the impact of an event or object on the circumstances and people around it.

For example, the significance of a historical event is the impact it had on society and future generations.

Significance is more concerned with the broader impact of something, while value is more concerned with its immediate practicality or usefulness.

Worth.wordDefinition:
The words value and worth are often used interchangeably, but they have slightly different meanings.

Worth refers to the emotional or moral significance something holds. For example, if you receive a gift from a loved one, it may not have a high value, but its worth may be priceless because of the sentiment behind it.

Both words are applicable in different situations. You might use the word value when talking about investments or trade, and you might use the word worth when talking about personal relationships, beliefs, or principles.

quotes.Text: In the past there were people who were not rich but contented with their living style, laughing and happy all day. But when the new rich people appear, people look at them and ask, 'why don't I have a life like that too, a beautiful house, car and garden,' and they abandon their values.
quotes.Title: Vietnamese Clergyman
quotes.Name: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.Text: If money help a man to do good to others, it is of some value; but if not, it is simply a mass of evil, and the sooner it is got rid of, the better.
quotes.Title: Indian Clergyman
quotes.Name: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.Text: There is no value in life except what you choose to place upon it and no happiness in any place except what you bring to it yourself.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.Text: Life being very short, and the quiet hours of it few, we ought to waste none of them in reading valueless books.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: John Ruskin

quotes.Text: We live in a world of shifting values. The family is falling apart. Parents failing in what they ought to do.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Gordon B. Hinckley

quotes.Text: I think your values are always influenced by your family and your community.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Dolly Parton

quotes.Text: Someone has to die in order that the rest of us should value life more.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Virginia Woolf

quotes.Text: Do you know the only value life has is what life puts on itself?
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Jack London

quotes.Text: It's rare for anyone to value the opinions of a teenage girl.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Billie Eilish

quotes.Text: We get paid for bringing value to the market place.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jim Rohn
